metadata.title: CVE-2017-17045 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x allowing HVM guest OS users togain privileges on the host OS, obtain sensitive information, or cause adenial of service (BUG and host OS crash) by leveraging the mishandling ofPopulate on Demand (PoD) Physical-to-Machine (P2M) errors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxendevicemodel1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenevtchn1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenforeignmemory1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxengnttab1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenhypfs1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenmisc4.17t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenstore4t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoolcore1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoollog1t64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xenstore-utils - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu1').
